   22: %%% File    : signal_SUITE.erl

   28: -module(signal_SUITE).
   29: -author('rickard.s.green@ericsson.com').
   30: 
   31: %-define(line_trace, 1).
   32: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   33: -export([all/0, suite/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   34: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   35: -export([groups/0, init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   36: 
   37: % Test cases
   38: -export([xm_sig_order/1,
   39:          kill2killed/1,
   40:          contended_signal_handling/1,
   41:          dirty_signal_handling_race/1,
   42:          dirty_signal_handling/1,
   43:          busy_dist_exit_signal/1,
   44:          busy_dist_demonitor_signal/1,
   45:          busy_dist_down_signal/1,
   46:          busy_dist_spawn_reply_signal/1,
   47:          busy_dist_unlink_ack_signal/1,
   48:          unlink_exit/1,
   49:          monitor_order/1,
   50:          monitor_named_order_local/1,
   51:          monitor_named_order_remote/1,
   52:          monitor_nodes_order/1,
   53:          move_msgs_off_heap_signal_basic/1,
   54:          move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv/1,
   55:          move_msgs_off_heap_signal_exit/1,
   56:          move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv_exit/1,
   57:          copy_literal_area_signal_basic/1,
   58:          copy_literal_area_signal_recv/1,
   59:          copy_literal_area_signal_exit/1,
   60:          copy_literal_area_signal_recv_exit/1,
   61:          simultaneous_signals_basic/1,
   62:          simultaneous_signals_recv/1,
   63:          simultaneous_signals_exit/1,
   64:          simultaneous_signals_recv_exit/1,
   65:          parallel_signal_enqueue_race_1/1,
   66:          parallel_signal_enqueue_race_2/1,
   67:          dirty_schedule/1]).
   68: 
   69: -export([spawn_spammers/3]).
   70: 
   71: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
   72:     [{testcase, Func}|Config].
   73: 
   74: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   75:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   76: 
   77: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   78:     Config.
   79: 
   80: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   81:     try erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)
   82:     catch  _:_ -> ok
   83:     end,
   84:     ok.
   85: 
   86: suite() ->
   87:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   88:      {timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
   89: 
   90: all() -> 
   91:     [xm_sig_order,
   92:      kill2killed,
   93:      contended_signal_handling,
   94:      dirty_signal_handling_race,
   95:      dirty_signal_handling,
   96:      busy_dist_exit_signal,
   97:      busy_dist_demonitor_signal,
   98:      busy_dist_down_signal,
   99:      busy_dist_spawn_reply_signal,
  100:      busy_dist_unlink_ack_signal,
  101:      unlink_exit,
  102:      monitor_order,
  103:      monitor_named_order_local,
  104:      monitor_named_order_remote,
  105:      monitor_nodes_order,
  106:      parallel_signal_enqueue_race_1,
  107:      parallel_signal_enqueue_race_2,
  108:      dirty_schedule,
  109:      {group, adjust_message_queue}].
  110: 
  111: groups() ->
  112:     [{adjust_message_queue, [],
  113:       [move_msgs_off_heap_signal_basic,
  114:        move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv,
  115:        move_msgs_off_heap_signal_exit,
  116:        move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv_exit,
  117:        copy_literal_area_signal_basic,
  118:        copy_literal_area_signal_recv,
  119:        copy_literal_area_signal_exit,
  120:        copy_literal_area_signal_recv_exit,
  121:        simultaneous_signals_basic,
  122:        simultaneous_signals_recv,
  123:        simultaneous_signals_exit,
  124:        simultaneous_signals_recv_exit]}].
  125: 
  126: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  127:     Config.
  128: 
  129: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  130:     Config.
  131: 
  132: %% Test that exit signals and messages are received in correct order
  133: xm_sig_order(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  134:     LNode = node(),
  135:     repeat(fun (_) -> xm_sig_order_test(LNode) end, 1000),
  136:     {ok, Peer, RNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  137:     repeat(fun (_) -> xm_sig_order_test(RNode) end, 1000),
  138:     peer:stop(Peer),
  139:     ok.
  140: 
  141: xm_sig_order_test(Node) ->
  142:     P = spawn(Node, fun () -> xm_sig_order_proc() end),
  143:     M = erlang:monitor(process, P),
  144:     P ! may_reach,
  145:     P ! may_reach,
  146:     P ! may_reach,
  147:     exit(P, good_signal_order),
  148:     P ! may_not_reach,
  149:     P ! may_not_reach,
  150:     P ! may_not_reach,
  151:     receive
  152: 	      {'DOWN', M, process, P, R} ->
  153: 		  good_signal_order = R
  154: 	  end.
  155: 
  156: xm_sig_order_proc() ->
  157:     receive
  158: 	may_not_reach -> exit(bad_signal_order);
  159: 	may_reach -> ok
  160:     after 0 -> erlang:yield()
  161:     end,
  162:     xm_sig_order_proc().
  163: 
  164: kill2killed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  165:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  166:     kill2killed_test(node()),
  167:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  168:     kill2killed_test(Node),
  169:     peer:stop(Peer).
  170: 
  171: kill2killed_test(Node) ->
  172:     if Node == node() ->
  173:             io:format("Testing against local node", []);
  174:        true ->
  175:             io:format("Testing against remote node ~p", [Node])
  176:     end,
  177:     check_exit(Node, other_exit2, 1),
  178:     check_exit(Node, other_exit2, 2),
  179:     check_exit(Node, other_exit2, 9),
  180:     check_exit(Node, other_exit2, 10),
  181:     check_exit(Node, exit2, 1),
  182:     check_exit(Node, exit2, 2),
  183:     check_exit(Node, exit2, 9),
  184:     check_exit(Node, exit2, 10),
  185:     check_exit(Node, exit1, 1),
  186:     check_exit(Node, exit1, 2),
  187:     check_exit(Node, exit1, 9),
  188:     check_exit(Node, exit1, 10),
  189:     ok.
  190: 
  191: check_exit(Node, Type, N) ->
  192:     io:format("Testing ~p length ~p~n", [Type, N]),
  193:     P = spawn_link_line(Node, node(), Type, N, self()),
  194:     if Type == other_exit2 ->
  195:             receive
  196:                 {end_of_line, EOL} ->
  197:                     exit(EOL, kill)
  198:             end;
  199:        true -> ok
  200:     end,
  201:     receive
  202:         {'EXIT', P, Reason} ->
  203:             if Type == exit1 ->
  204:                     kill = Reason;
  205:                true ->
  206:                     killed = Reason
  207:             end
  208:     end.
  209: 
  210: spawn_link_line(_NodeA, _NodeB, other_exit2, 0, Tester) ->
  211:     Tester ! {end_of_line, self()},
  212:     receive after infinity -> ok end;
  213: spawn_link_line(_NodeA, _NodeB, exit1, 0, _Tester) ->
  214:     exit(kill);
  215: spawn_link_line(_NodeA, _NodeB, exit2, 0, _Tester) ->
  216:     exit(self(), kill);
  217: spawn_link_line(NodeA, NodeB, Type, N, Tester) ->
  218:     spawn_link(NodeA,
  219:                fun () ->
  220:                        spawn_link_line(NodeB, NodeA, Type, N-1, Tester),
  221:                        receive after infinity -> ok end
  222:                end).
  223: 
  224: contended_signal_handling(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  225:     %%
  226:     %% Test for a race in signal handling of a process.
  227:     %%
  228:     %% When executing dirty, a "dirty signal handler"
  229:     %% process will handle signals for the process. If
  230:     %% the process stops executing dirty while the dirty
  231:     %% signal handler process is handling signals on
  232:     %% behalf of the process, both the dirty signal handler
  233:     %% process and the process itself might try to handle
  234:     %% signals for the process at the same time. There used
  235:     %% to be a bug that caused both processes to enter the
  236:     %% signal handling code simultaneously when the main
  237:     %% lock of the process was temporarily released during
  238:     %% signal handling (see GH-4885/OTP-17462/PR-4914).
  239:     %% Currently the main lock is only released when the
  240:     %% process receives an 'unlock' signal from a port,
  241:     %% and then responds by sending an 'unlock-ack' signal
  242:     %% to the port. This testcase tries to massage that
  243:     %% scenario. It is quite hard to cause a crash even
  244:     %% when the bug exists, but this testcase at least
  245:     %% sometimes causes a crash when the bug is present.
  246:     %%
  247:     move_dirty_signal_handlers_to_first_scheduler(),
  248:     process_flag(priority, high),
  249:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  250:         1 ->
  251:             ok;
  252:         SOnln -> 
  253:             process_flag(scheduler, SOnln),
  254:             ok
  255:     end,
  256:     Drv = unlink_signal_drv,
  257:     ok = load_driver(Config, Drv),
  258:     try
  259:         contended_signal_handling_test(Drv, 250)
  260:     after
  261:         ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv)
  262:     end,
  263:     ok.
  264: 
  265: contended_signal_handling_test(_Drv, 0) ->
  266:     ok;
  267: contended_signal_handling_test(Drv, N) ->
  268:     Ports = contended_signal_handling_make_ports(Drv, 100, []),
  269:     erlang:yield(),
  270:     contended_signal_handling_cmd_ports(Ports),
  271:     erts_debug:dirty_cpu(wait, rand:uniform(5)),
  272:     wait_until(fun () -> Ports == Ports -- erlang:ports() end),
  273:     contended_signal_handling_test(Drv, N-1).
  274: 
  275: contended_signal_handling_cmd_ports([]) ->
  276:     ok;
  277: contended_signal_handling_cmd_ports([P|Ps]) ->
  278:     P ! {self(), {command, "c"}},
  279:     contended_signal_handling_cmd_ports(Ps).
  280: 
  281: contended_signal_handling_make_ports(_Drv, 0, Ports) ->
  282:     Ports;
  283: contended_signal_handling_make_ports(Drv, N, Ports) ->
  284:     Port = open_port({spawn, Drv}, []),
  285:     true = is_port(Port),
  286:     contended_signal_handling_make_ports(Drv, N-1, [Port|Ports]).
  287: 
  288: dirty_signal_handling_race(Config) ->
  289:     %% This test case trigger more or less the same
  290:     %% problematic scenario as the contended_signal_handling
  291:     %% test case is trying to trigger. This test case triggers
  292:     %% it via another signal and is also much more likely
  293:     %% (close to 100%) to trigger the problematic schenario.
  294:     Tester = self(),
  295:     move_dirty_signal_handlers_to_first_scheduler(),
  296:     {S0, S1} = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  297:                    1 -> {1, 1};
  298:                    2 -> {2, 1};
  299:                    SOnln -> {SOnln, SOnln-1}
  300:                end,
  301:     process_flag(priority, high),
  302:     process_flag(scheduler, S0),
  303:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  304:     Drv = unlink_signal_drv,
  305:     ok = load_driver(Config, Drv),
  306:     try
  307:         %% {parallelism, true} option will ensure that each
  308:         %% signal to the port from a process is scheduled which
  309:         %% forces the process to release its main lock when
  310:         %% sending the signal...
  311:         Port = open_port({spawn, Drv}, [{parallelism, true}]),
  312:         true = is_port(Port),
  313:         %% The {alias, reply_demonitor} option will trigger a
  314:         %% 'demonitor' signal from Tester to the port when an
  315:         %% alias message sent using the alias is received by
  316:         %% Tester...
  317:         MA1 = erlang:monitor(port, Port, [{alias, reply_demonitor}]),
  318:         MA2 = erlang:monitor(port, Port, [{alias, reply_demonitor}]),
  319:         Pid = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  320:                                 Tester ! go,
  321:                                 receive after 500 -> ok end,
  322:                                 %% The 'proc_sig_block' test signal will cause
  323:                                 %% dirty signal handling to start and be
  324:                                 %% blocked in the signal handling.
  325:                                 erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_block,
  326:                                                               {Tester, 1000}),
  327:                                 %% Tester will be stuck waiting for main lock
  328:                                 %% when being scheduled out from its dirty
  329:                                 %% execution. When this alias message is
  330:                                 %% by the dirty signal handler Tester will be
  331:                                 %% able to aquire the main lock and complete
  332:                                 %% the schedule out operation.
  333:                                 MA1 ! {MA1, trigger_demonitor_port_please},
  334:                                 erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_block,
  335:                                                               {Tester, 100}),
  336:                                 %% Tester will have been selected for
  337:                                 %% execution, but stuck waiting for main lock.
  338:                                 %% When this alias message is handled by the
  339:                                 %% dirty signal handler, Tester will be able
  340:                                 %% to aquire the main lock which will let it
  341:                                 %% enter the problematic scenario. That is,
  342:                                 %% ongoing dirty signal handling while it
  343:                                 %% begins executing.
  344:                                 MA2 ! {MA2, trigger_demonitor_port_please},
  345:                                 erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_block,
  346:                                                               {Tester, 500}),
  347:                                 ok
  348:                         end, [link, {scheduler, S1}]),
  349:         receive go -> ok end,
  350:         receive {'DOWN', MA1, port, Port, _} -> ct:fail(unexpected_port_down)
  351:         after 0 -> ok
  352:         end,
  353:         receive {'DOWN', MA2, port, Port, _} -> ct:fail(unexpected_port_down)
  354:         after 0 -> ok
  355:         end,
  356:         erts_debug:dirty_cpu(wait, 1000),
  357:         receive
  358:             {MA1, trigger_demonitor_port_please} -> ok
  359:         end,
  360:         receive
  361:             {MA2, trigger_demonitor_port_please} -> ok
  362:         end,
  363:         unlink(Pid),
  364:         unlink(Port),
  365:         exit(Pid, kill),
  366:         exit(Port, kill),
  367:         false = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid)
  368:     after
  369:         ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv)
  370:     end,
  371:     ok.
  372: 
  373: move_dirty_signal_handlers_to_first_scheduler() ->
  374:     SOnln = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, 1),
  375:     try
  376:         true = lists:foldl(
  377:                  fun (Pid, FoundOne) ->
  378:                          case process_info(Pid, initial_call) of
  379:                              {initial_call, {erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}} ->
  380:                                  Pid ! please_execute_a_bit,
  381:                                  true;
  382:                              _ ->
  383:                                  FoundOne
  384:                          end
  385:                  end,
  386:                  false,
  387:                  processes())
  388:     after
  389:         erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SOnln)
  390:     end,
  391:     ok.
  392: 
  393: dirty_signal_handling(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  394:     %%
  395:     %% PR-7822 (third commit)
  396:     %%
  397:     %% Make sure signals are handled regardless of whether a process is
  398:     %% executing dirty or is scheduled for dirty execution...
  399: 
  400:     %% Make sure all dirty I/O schedulers are occupied with work...
  401:     Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  402:                            spawn(fun () ->
  403:                                          erts_debug:dirty_io(wait, 1000)
  404:                                  end)
  405:                    end, lists:seq(1, erlang:system_info(dirty_io_schedulers))),
  406:     %% P ends up in the run queue waiting for a free dirty I/O scheduler...
  407:     P = spawn(fun () ->
  408:                       erts_debug:dirty_io(wait, 1000)
  409:               end),
  410:     receive after 300 -> ok end,
  411:     %% current_function is added to prevent read of status from being optimized
  412:     %% to read status directly...
  413:     [{status,runnable},{current_function, _}] = process_info(P, [status,current_function]),
  414:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  415:     [{status,running},{current_function, _}] = process_info(P, [status,current_function]),
  416:     lists:foreach(fun (X) -> exit(X, kill) end, [P|Ps]),
  417:     lists:foreach(fun (X) -> false = is_process_alive(X) end, [P|Ps]),
  418:     ok.
  419: 
  420: busy_dist_exit_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  421:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  422: 
  423:     BusyTime = 1000,
  424:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  425:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  426:     Tester = self(),
  427:     {Exiter,MRef} = spawn_monitor(BusyChannelNode,
  428:                                   fun () ->
  429:                                           pong = net_adm:ping(OtherNode),
  430:                                           Tester ! {self(), alive},
  431:                                           receive after infinity -> ok end
  432:                                   end),
  433:     receive
  434:         {Exiter, alive} ->
  435:             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]);
  436:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Why, normal} ->
  437:             ct:fail({exiter_died, Why})
  438:     end,
  439:     Linker = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  440:                         fun () ->
  441:                                 process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  442:                                 link(Exiter),
  443:                                 receive
  444:                                     {'EXIT', Exiter, Reason} ->
  445:                                         tester_killed_me = Reason,
  446:                                         Tester ! {self(), got_exiter_exit_message};
  447:                                     Unexpected ->
  448:                                         exit({unexpected_message, Unexpected})
  449:                                 end
  450:                          end),
  451:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  452:     exit(Exiter, tester_killed_me),
  453:     receive
  454:         {Linker, got_exiter_exit_message} ->
  455:             unlink(Linker),
  456:             ok
  457:     after
  458:         BusyTime*2 ->
  459:             ct:fail(missing_exit_signal)
  460:     end,
  461:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  462:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  463:     ok.
  464: 
  465: busy_dist_demonitor_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  466:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  467: 
  468:     BusyTime = 1000,
  469:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  470:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  471:     Tester = self(),
  472:     Demonitorer = spawn(BusyChannelNode,
  473:                         fun () ->
  474:                                 pong = net_adm:ping(OtherNode),
  475:                                 Tester ! {self(), alive},
  476:                                 receive
  477:                                     {Tester, monitor, Pid} ->
  478:                                         _Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid)
  479:                                 end,
  480:                                 receive after infinity -> ok end
  481:                         end),
  482:     receive {Demonitorer, alive} -> ok end,
  483:     Demonitoree = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  484:                              fun () ->
  485:                                      wait_until(fun () ->
  486:                                                         {monitored_by, MB1}
  487:                                                             = process_info(self(),
  488:                                                                            monitored_by),
  489:                                                         lists:member(Demonitorer, MB1)
  490:                                                 end),
  491:                                      Tester ! {self(), monitored},
  492:                                      wait_until(fun () ->
  493:                                                         {monitored_by, MB2}
  494:                                                             = process_info(self(),
  495:                                                                            monitored_by),
  496:                                                         not lists:member(Demonitorer, MB2)
  497:                                                 end),
  498:                                      Tester ! {self(), got_demonitorer_demonitor_signal}
  499:                              end),
  500:     Demonitorer ! {self(), monitor, Demonitoree},
  501:     receive {Demonitoree, monitored} -> ok end,
  502:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  503:     exit(Demonitorer, tester_killed_me),
  504:     receive
  505:         {Demonitoree, got_demonitorer_demonitor_signal} ->
  506:             unlink(Demonitoree),
  507:             ok
  508:     after
  509:         BusyTime*2 ->
  510:             ct:fail(missing_demonitor_signal)
  511:     end,
  512:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  513:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  514:     ok.
  515: 
  516: busy_dist_down_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  517:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  518: 
  519:     BusyTime = 1000,
  520:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  521:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  522:     Tester = self(),
  523:     {Exiter,MRef} = spawn_monitor(BusyChannelNode,
  524:                                   fun () ->
  525:                                           pong = net_adm:ping(OtherNode),
  526:                                           Tester ! {self(), alive},
  527:                                           receive after infinity -> ok end
  528:                                   end),
  529:     receive
  530:         {Exiter, alive} ->
  531:             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]);
  532:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Why, normal} ->
  533:             ct:fail({exiter_died, Why})
  534:     end,
  535:     Monitorer = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  536:                         fun () ->
  537:                                 process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  538:                                 Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Exiter),
  539:                                 receive
  540:                                     {'DOWN', Mon, process, Exiter, Reason} ->
  541:                                         tester_killed_me = Reason,
  542:                                         Tester ! {self(), got_exiter_down_message};
  543:                                     Unexpected ->
  544:                                         exit({unexpected_message, Unexpected})
  545:                                 end
  546:                          end),
  547:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  548:     exit(Exiter, tester_killed_me),
  549:     receive
  550:         {Monitorer, got_exiter_down_message} ->
  551:             unlink(Monitorer),
  552:             ok
  553:     after
  554:         BusyTime*2 ->
  555:             ct:fail(missing_down_signal)
  556:     end,
  557:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  558:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  559:     ok.
  560: 
  561: busy_dist_spawn_reply_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  562:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  563: 
  564:     BusyTime = 1000,
  565:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  566:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  567:     Tester = self(),
  568:     Spawner = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  569:                          fun () ->
  570:                                  pong = net_adm:ping(BusyChannelNode),
  571:                                  Tester ! {self(), ready},
  572:                                  receive {Tester, go} -> ok end,
  573:                                  ReqID = spawn_request(BusyChannelNode,
  574:                                                        fun () -> ok end,
  575:                                                        []),
  576:                                  receive
  577:                                      {spawn_reply, ReqID, Result, _Pid} ->
  578:                                          ok = Result,
  579:                                          Tester ! {self(), got_spawn_reply_message};
  580:                                      Unexpected ->
  581:                                          exit({unexpected_message, Unexpected})
  582:                                  end
  583:                          end),
  584:     receive {Spawner, ready} -> ok end,
  585:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  586:     Spawner ! {self(), go},
  587:     receive
  588:         {Spawner, got_spawn_reply_message} ->
  589:             unlink(Spawner),
  590:             ok
  591:     after
  592:         BusyTime*2 ->
  593:             ct:fail(missing_spawn_reply_signal)
  594:     end,
  595:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  596:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  597:     ok.
  598: 
  599: -record(erl_link, {type,           % process | port | dist_process
  600:                    pid = [],
  601:                    state,          % linked | unlinking
  602:                    id}).
  603: 
  604: busy_dist_unlink_ack_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  605:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  606: 
  607:     BusyTime = 1000,
  608:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  609:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  610:     Tester = self(),
  611:     {Unlinkee,MRef} = spawn_monitor(BusyChannelNode,
  612:                                     fun () ->
  613:                                             pong = net_adm:ping(OtherNode),
  614:                                             Tester ! {self(), alive},
  615:                                             receive after infinity -> ok end
  616:                                     end),
  617:     receive
  618:         {Unlinkee, alive} ->
  619:             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]);
  620:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Why, normal} ->
  621:             ct:fail({unlinkee_died, Why})
  622:     end,
  623:     Unlinker = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  624:                           fun () ->
  625:                                   erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  626:                                   link(Unlinkee),
  627:                                   #erl_link{type = dist_process,
  628:                                             pid = Unlinkee,
  629:                                             state = linked} = find_proc_link(self(),
  630:                                                                              Unlinkee),
  631:                                   Tester ! {self(), ready},
  632:                                   receive {Tester, go} -> ok end,
  633:                                   unlink(Unlinkee),
  634:                                   #erl_link{type = dist_process,
  635:                                             pid = Unlinkee,
  636:                                             state = unlinking} = find_proc_link(self(),
  637:                                                                                 Unlinkee),
  638:                                   wait_until(fun () ->
  639:                                                      false == find_proc_link(self(),
  640:                                                                              Unlinkee)
  641:                                              end),
  642:                                   Tester ! {self(), got_unlink_ack_signal}
  643:                           end),
  644:     receive {Unlinker, ready} -> ok end,
  645:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  646:     Unlinker ! {self(), go},
  647:     receive
  648:         {Unlinker, got_unlink_ack_signal} ->
  649:             unlink(Unlinker),
  650:             ok
  651:     after
  652:         BusyTime*2 ->
  653:             ct:fail(missing_unlink_ack_signal)
  654:     end,
  655:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  656:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  657:     ok.
  658: 
  659: unlink_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  660:     %% OTP-18177
  661:     %%
  662:     %% This bug is theoretically possible, at least in the
  663:     %% node local scenario, but more or less undetectable and
  664:     %% quite harmless when it hits. A process A (the child in
  665:     %% the testcase) could get actual exit reason of another
  666:     %% process B (the parent in the testcase) when it should
  667:     %% have gotten 'noproc' as exit reason. This can happen if
  668:     %% 1. B unlinks A
  669:     %% 2. B begin terminating before it has received an unlink
  670:     %%    ack from A
  671:     %% 3. A links to B after it has received the unlink signal
  672:     %%
  673:     %% This testcase hammers on the above scenario, but I have
  674:     %% not seen it fail yet though when the bug is present...
  675:     repeat(fun unlink_exit_test/0, 1000).
  676: 
  677: unlink_exit_test() ->
  678:     Tester = self(),
  679:     ChildFun =
  680:         fun () ->
  681:                 process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  682:                 Tester ! {child, self()},
  683:                 Parent = receive {tester_parent, Tester, Pid} -> Pid end,
  684:                 Parent ! {go, self()},
  685:                 busy_wait_until(fun () ->
  686:                                         receive {go, Parent} -> true
  687:                                         after 0 -> false
  688:                                         end
  689:                                 end),
  690:                 IsAlive = erlang:is_process_alive(Parent),
  691:                 try
  692:                     link(Parent),
  693:                     case IsAlive of
  694:                         false ->
  695:                             receive
  696:                                 {'EXIT', Parent, noproc} ->
  697:                                     exit(ok);
  698:                                 {'EXIT', Parent, R1} ->
  699:                                     exit({not_alive_unexpected_exit_reason, R1})
  700:                             after 1000 ->
  701:                                     exit(not_alive_missing_exit)
  702:                             end;
  703:                         true ->
  704:                             receive
  705:                                 {'EXIT', Parent, R2} when R2 == noproc;
  706:                                                           R2 == bye ->
  707:                                     exit(ok);
  708:                                 {'EXIT', Parent, R2} ->
  709:                                     exit({alive_unexpected_exit_reason, R2})
  710:                             after 1000 ->
  711:                                     exit(alive_missing_exit)
  712:                             end
  713:                     end
  714:                 catch error:noproc ->
  715:                         receive
  716:                             {'EXIT', Parent, _} = X0 ->
  717:                                 exit({unexpected_exit, X0})
  718:                         after 1000 ->
  719:                                 exit(ok)
  720:                         end
  721:                 end
  722:         end,
  723:     {Parent, PMon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  724:                                        %% Work to do when terminating in order
  725:                                        %% to increase the likelyhood of the
  726:                                        %% bug triggering (if present)...
  727:                                        T = ets:new(x,[]),
  728:                                        ets:insert(T, lists:map(fun (I) ->
  729:                                                                        {I,I}
  730:                                                                end,
  731:                                                                lists:seq(1,10000))),
  732: 
  733:                                        Child = spawn_opt(ChildFun,
  734:                                                          [{priority, high},
  735:                                                           link]),
  736:                                        receive {go, Child} -> ok end,
  737:                                        unlink(Child),
  738:                                        Child ! {go, self()},
  739:                                        exit(bye)
  740:                                end, [{priority, high}, monitor]),
  741:     Child = receive {child, Chld} -> Chld end,
  742:     CMon = erlang:monitor(process, Child),
  743:     Child ! {tester_parent, Tester, Parent},
  744:     receive
  745:         {'DOWN', PMon, process, Parent, bye} ->
  746:             ok
  747:     end,
  748:     receive
  749:         {'DOWN', CMon, process, Child, ok} ->
  750:             ok;
  751:         {'DOWN', CMon, process, Child, ChildReason} ->
  752:             ct:fail(ChildReason)
  753:     end.
  754: 
  755: %% Monitors could be reordered relative to message signals when the parallel
  756: %% signal sending optimization was active.
  757: monitor_order(_Config) ->
  758:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  759:     monitor_order_1(10).
  760: 
  761: monitor_order_1(0) ->
  762:     ok;
  763: monitor_order_1(N) ->
  764:     Self = self(),
  765:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  766:                                         receive
  767:                                             MRef ->
  768:                                                 %% The first message sets up
  769:                                                 %% the parallel signal buffer,
  770:                                                 %% the second uses it.
  771:                                                 Self ! {self(), MRef, first},
  772:                                                 Self ! {self(), MRef, second}
  773:                                         end,
  774:                                         exit(normal)
  775:                                 end),
  776:     Pid ! MRef,
  777:     receive
  778:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, _, normal} ->
  779:             ct:fail("Down signal arrived before second message!");
  780:         {Pid, MRef, second} ->
  781:             receive {Pid, MRef, first} -> ok end,
  782:             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]),
  783:             monitor_order_1(N - 1)
  784:     end.
  785: 
  786: %% Signal order: Message vs DOWN from local process monitored by name.
  787: monitor_named_order_local(_Config) ->
  788:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  789:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  790:     true = erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_buffers, true),
  791: 
  792:     LNode = node(),
  793:     repeat(fun (N) -> monitor_named_order(LNode, N) end, 100),
  794:     ok.
  795: 
  796: %% Signal order: Message vs DOWN from remote process monitored by name.
  797: monitor_named_order_remote(_Config) ->
  798:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  799:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  800:     true = erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_buffers, true),
  801: 
  802:     {ok, Peer, RNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  803:     repeat(fun (N) -> monitor_named_order(RNode, N) end, 10),
  804:     peer:stop(Peer),
  805:     ok.
  806: 
  807: monitor_named_order(Node, N) ->
  808:     %% Send messages using pid, name and alias.
  809:     Pid = self(),
  810:     register(tester, Pid),
  811:     Name = {tester, node()},
  812:     AliasA = alias(),
  813:     NumMsg = 1000 + N,
  814:     Sender = spawn_link(Node,
  815:                      fun() ->
  816:                              register(monitor_named_order, self()),
  817:                              Pid ! {self(), ready},
  818:                              {go, AliasM} = receive_any(),
  819:                              send_msg_seq(Pid, Name, AliasA, AliasM, NumMsg),
  820:                              exit(normal)
  821:                      end),
  822:     {Sender, ready} = receive_any(),
  823:     AliasM = monitor(process, {monitor_named_order,Node},
  824:                      [{alias,explicit_unalias}]),
  825:     Sender ! {go, AliasM},
  826:     recv_msg_seq(NumMsg),
  827:     {'DOWN', AliasM, process, {monitor_named_order,Node}, normal}
  828:         = receive_any(),
  829:     unregister(tester),
  830:     unalias(AliasA),
  831:     unalias(AliasM),
  832:     ok.
  833: 
  834: send_msg_seq(_, _, _, _, 0) -> ok;
  835: send_msg_seq(To1, To2, To3, To4, N) ->
  836:     To1 ! N,
  837:     send_msg_seq(To2, To3, To4, To1, N-1).
  838: 
  839: recv_msg_seq(0) -> ok;
  840: recv_msg_seq(N) ->
  841:     N = receive M -> M end,
  842:     recv_msg_seq(N-1).
  843: 
  844: receive_any() ->
  845:     receive M -> M end.
  846: 
  847: receive_any(Timeout) ->
  848:     receive M -> M
  849:     after Timeout -> timeout
  850:     end.
  851: 
  852: monitor_nodes_order(_Config) ->
  853:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  854:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  855:     true = erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_buffers, true),
  856: 
  857:     {ok, Peer, RNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{peer_down => continue,
  858:                                    connection => 0}),
  859:     Self = self(),
  860:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true, [nodedown_reason]),
  861:     [] = nodes(connected),
  862:     Pids = peer:call(Peer, ?MODULE, spawn_spammers, [64, Self, []]),
  863:     {nodeup, RNode, []} = receive_any(),
  864: 
  865:     ok = peer:cast(Peer, erlang, halt, [0]),
  866: 
  867:     [put(P, 0) || P <- Pids],  % spam counters per sender
  868:     {nodedown, RNode, [{nodedown_reason,connection_closed}]} =
  869:         receive_filter_spam(),
  870:     [io:format("From spammer ~p: ~p messages\n", [P, get(P)]) || P <- Pids],
  871:     timeout = receive_any(100),   % Nothing after nodedown
  872: 
  873:     {down, tcp_closed} = peer:get_state(Peer),
  874:     peer:stop(Peer),
  875:     ok.
  876: 
  877: spawn_spammers(0, _To, Acc) ->
  878:     Acc;
  879: spawn_spammers(N, To, Acc) ->
  880:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> spam_pid(To, 1) end),
  881:     spawn_spammers(N-1, To, [Pid | Acc]).
  882: 
  883: spam_pid(To, N) ->
  884:     To ! {spam, self(), N},
  885:     erlang:yield(), % Let other spammers run to get lots of different senders
  886:     spam_pid(To, N+1).
  887: 
  888: receive_filter_spam() ->
  889:     receive
  890:         {spam, From, N} ->
  891:             match(N, get(From) + 1),
  892:             put(From, N),
  893:             receive_filter_spam();
  894:         M -> M
  895:     end.
  896: 
  897: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  898:     move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(false, false).
  899: 
  900: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  901:     move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(true, false).
  902: 
  903: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  904:     move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(false, true).
  905: 
  906: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  907:     move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(true, true).
  908: 
  909: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(RecvPair, Exit) ->
  910:     erlang:trace(new_processes, true, [running_procs]),
  911:     SFact = test_server:timetrap_scale_factor(),
  912:     GoTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) + 1000*SFact,
  913:     ProcF = fun () ->
  914:                     Now = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  915:                     Tmo = case GoTime - Now of
  916:                               Left when Left < 0 ->
  917:                                   erlang:display({go_time_passed, Left}),
  918:                                   0;
  919:                               Left ->
  920:                                   Left
  921:                           end,
  922:                     receive after Tmo -> ok end,
  923:                     on_heap = process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  924:                     if RecvPair -> receive_integer_pairs(infinity);
  925:                        true -> receive after infinity -> ok end
  926:                     end
  927:             end,
  928:     Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  929:                            spawn_opt(ProcF,
  930:                                      [link,
  931:                                       {message_queue_data, on_heap}])
  932:                    end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
  933:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
  934:                           lists:foreach(fun (N) when N rem 100 == 0 ->
  935:                                                 P ! [N|N];
  936:                                             (N) ->
  937:                                                 P ! N
  938:                                         end, lists:seq(1, 10000))
  939:                   end, Ps),
  940:     Now = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  941:     Tmo = case GoTime - Now + 10 of
  942:               Left when Left < 0 ->
  943:                   erlang:display({go_time_passed, Left}),
  944:                   0;
  945:               Left ->
  946:                   Left
  947:           end,
  948:     receive after Tmo -> ok end,
  949:     if Exit ->
  950:             _ = lists:foldl(fun (P, N) when N rem 10 ->
  951:                                     unlink(P),
  952:                                     exit(P, terminated),
  953:                                     N+1;
  954:                                 (_P, N) ->
  955:                                     N+1
  956:                             end,
  957:                             0,
  958:                             Ps),
  959:             ok;
  960:        true ->
  961:             ok
  962:     end,
  963:     wait_traced_not_running(1000 + 200*SFact),
  964:     erlang:trace(new_processes, false, [running_procs]),
  965:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
  966:                           unlink(P),
  967:                           exit(P, kill)
  968:                   end, Ps),
  969:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
  970:                           false = is_process_alive(P)
  971:                   end, Ps),
  972:     ok.
  973: 
  974: copy_literal_area_signal_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  975:     copy_literal_area_signal_test(false, false).
  976: 
  977: copy_literal_area_signal_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  978:     copy_literal_area_signal_test(true, false).
  979: 
  980: copy_literal_area_signal_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  981:     copy_literal_area_signal_test(false, true).
  982: 
  983: copy_literal_area_signal_recv_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  984:     copy_literal_area_signal_test(true, true).
  985: 
  986: copy_literal_area_signal_test(RecvPair, Exit) ->
  987:     persistent_term:put({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}, make_ref()),
  988:     Literal = persistent_term:get({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
  989:     true = is_reference(Literal),
  990:     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Literal), %% Should be a literal...
  991:     ProcF = fun () ->
  992:                     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Literal), %% Should be a literal...
  993:                     if RecvPair ->
  994:                             receive receive_pairs -> ok end,
  995:                             receive_integer_pairs(0);
  996:                        true ->
  997:                             ok
  998:                     end,
  999:                     receive check_literal_conversion -> ok end,
 1000:                     receive
 1001:                         Literal ->
 1002:                             %% Should not be a literal anymore...
 1003:                             false = (0 == erts_debug:size_shared(Literal))
 1004:                     end
 1005:             end,
 1006:     PMs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1007:                             spawn_opt(ProcF, [link, monitor])
 1008:                     end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
 1009:     lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
 1010:                           lists:foreach(fun (N) when N rem 100 == 0 ->
 1011:                                                 P ! [N|N];
 1012:                                             (N) ->
 1013:                                                 P ! N
 1014:                                         end, lists:seq(1, 10000)),
 1015:                           P ! Literal
 1016:                   end, PMs),
 1017:     persistent_term:erase({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
 1018:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1019:     if RecvPair ->
 1020:             lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
 1021:                                   P ! receive_pairs
 1022:                           end, PMs);
 1023:        true ->
 1024:             ok
 1025:     end,
 1026:     if Exit ->
 1027:             _ = lists:foldl(fun ({P, _M}, N) when N rem 10 ->
 1028:                                     unlink(P),
 1029:                                     exit(P, terminated),
 1030:                                     N+1;
 1031:                                 (_PM, N) ->
 1032:                                     N+1
 1033:                             end,
 1034:                             0,
 1035:                             PMs),
 1036:             ok;
 1037:        true ->
 1038:             ok
 1039:     end,
 1040:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(),
 1041:     lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
 1042:                           P ! check_literal_conversion
 1043:                   end, PMs),
 1044:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 1045:                           receive
 1046:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, R} ->
 1047:                                   case R of
 1048:                                       normal -> ok;
 1049:                                       terminated -> ok
 1050:                                   end
 1051:                           end
 1052:                   end, PMs),
 1053:     ok.
 1054: 
 1055: simultaneous_signals_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1056:     simultaneous_signals_test(false, false).
 1057: 
 1058: simultaneous_signals_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1059:     simultaneous_signals_test(true, false).
 1060: 
 1061: simultaneous_signals_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1062:     simultaneous_signals_test(false, true).
 1063: 
 1064: simultaneous_signals_recv_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1065:     simultaneous_signals_test(true, true).
 1066: 
 1067: simultaneous_signals_test(RecvPairs, Exit) ->
 1068:     erlang:trace(new_processes, true, [running_procs]),
 1069:     persistent_term:put({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}, make_ref()),
 1070:     Literal = persistent_term:get({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
 1071:     true = is_reference(Literal),
 1072:     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Literal), %% Should be a literal...
 1073:     SFact = test_server:timetrap_scale_factor(),
 1074:     GoTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) + 1000*SFact,
 1075:     ProcF = fun () ->
 1076:                     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Literal), %% Should be a literal...
 1077:                     Now = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
 1078:                     Tmo = case GoTime - Now of
 1079:                               Left when Left < 0 ->
 1080:                                   erlang:display({go_time_passed, Left}),
 1081:                                   0;
 1082:                               Left ->
 1083:                                   Left
 1084:                           end,
 1085:                     receive after Tmo -> ok end,
 1086:                     on_heap = process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
 1087:                     if RecvPairs -> receive_integer_pairs(0);
 1088:                        true -> ok
 1089:                     end,
 1090:                     receive check_literal_conversion -> ok end,
 1091:                     receive
 1092:                         Literal ->
 1093:                             %% Should not be a literal anymore...
 1094:                             false = (0 == erts_debug:size_shared(Literal))
 1095:                     end
 1096:             end,
 1097:     PMs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1098:                             spawn_opt(ProcF,
 1099:                                       [link,
 1100:                                        monitor,
 1101:                                        {message_queue_data, on_heap}])
 1102:                     end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
 1103:     lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
 1104:                           lists:foreach(fun (N) when N rem 100 == 0 ->
 1105:                                                 P ! [N|N];
 1106:                                             (N) ->
 1107:                                                 P ! N
 1108:                                         end, lists:seq(1, 10000)),
 1109:                           P ! Literal
 1110:                   end, PMs),
 1111:     Now = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
 1112:     Tmo = case GoTime - Now - 5 of % a bit earlier...
 1113:               Left when Left < 0 ->
 1114:                   erlang:display({go_time_passed, Left}),
 1115:                   0;
 1116:               Left ->
 1117:                   Left
 1118:           end,
 1119:     receive after Tmo -> ok end,
 1120:     persistent_term:erase({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
 1121:     receive after 10 -> ok end,
 1122:     if Exit ->
 1123:             _ = lists:foldl(fun ({P, _M}, N) when N rem 10 ->
 1124:                                     unlink(P),
 1125:                                     exit(P, terminated),
 1126:                                     N+1;
 1127:                                 (_PM, N) ->
 1128:                                     N+1
 1129:                             end,
 1130:                             0,
 1131:                             PMs),
 1132:             ok;
 1133:        true ->
 1134:             ok
 1135:     end,
 1136:     wait_traced_not_running(1000 + 200*SFact),
 1137:     erlang:trace(new_processes, false, [running_procs]),
 1138:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(),
 1139:     lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
 1140:                           P ! check_literal_conversion
 1141:                   end, PMs),
 1142:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 1143:                           receive
 1144:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, R} ->
 1145:                                   case R of
 1146:                                       normal -> ok;
 1147:                                       terminated -> ok
 1148:                                   end
 1149:                           end
 1150:                   end, PMs),
 1151:     ok.
 1152:     
 1153: 
 1154: wait_traced_not_running(Tmo) ->
 1155:     receive
 1156:         {trace,_,What,_} when What == in;
 1157:                               What == out ->
 1158:             wait_traced_not_running(Tmo)
 1159:     after
 1160:         Tmo ->
 1161:             ok
 1162:     end.
 1163: 
 1164: receive_integer_pairs(Tmo) ->
 1165:     receive
 1166:         [N|N] ->
 1167:             receive_integer_pairs(Tmo)
 1168:     after
 1169:         Tmo ->
 1170:             ok
 1171:     end.
 1172: 
 1173: parallel_signal_enqueue_race_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1174:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 1175:     try
 1176:         lists:foreach(fun (_) -> parallel_signal_enqueue_race_1_test() end,
 1177:                       lists:seq(1, 5))
 1178:     after
 1179:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)
 1180:     end.
 1181: 
 1182: parallel_signal_enqueue_race_1_test() ->
 1183:     %%
 1184:     %% PR-7822 (first commit)
 1185:     %%
 1186:     %% This bug could be triggered when
 1187:     %% * receiver had parallel signal enqueue optimization enabled
 1188:     %% * receiver fetched signals while it wasn't in a running state (only
 1189:     %%   happens when receive traced)
 1190:     %% * signals were enqueued simultaneously as the fetch of signals
 1191:     %%
 1192:     %% When the bug was triggered, the receiver could end up in an inconsistent
 1193:     %% state where it potentially would be stuck for ever.
 1194:     %%
 1195:     %% The above scenario is very hard to trigger, so the test typically do
 1196:     %% not fail even with the bug present, but we at least try to massage
 1197:     %% the scenario...
 1198:     R = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1199:                           true = erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_buffers,
 1200:                                                                true),
 1201:                           receive after infinity -> ok end
 1202:                   end,
 1203:                   [{message_queue_data, off_heap}, {priority, high}, link]),
 1204:     T = spawn_link(fun FlushTrace () ->
 1205:                            receive {trace,R,'receive',_} -> ok end,
 1206:                            FlushTrace()
 1207:                    end),
 1208:     1 = erlang:trace(R, true, ['receive', {tracer, T}]),
 1209:     CountLoop = fun CountLoop (0) ->
 1210:                         ok;
 1211:                     CountLoop (N) ->
 1212:                         CountLoop(N-1)
 1213:                 end,
 1214:     SigLoop = fun SigLoop (0)  ->
 1215:                       ok;
 1216:                   SigLoop (N) ->
 1217:                       CountLoop(rand:uniform(4000)),
 1218:                       erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, R), [flush]),
 1219:                       receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1220:                       SigLoop(N-1)
 1221:               end,
 1222:     SMs = lists:map(fun (X) ->
 1223:                             spawn_opt(fun () -> SigLoop(1000) end,
 1224:                                       [{scheduler, X}, link, monitor])
 1225:                     end, lists:seq(1,erlang:system_info(schedulers_online))),
 1226:     R ! hello,
 1227:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 1228:                           receive {'DOWN', M, process, P, _} -> ok end
 1229:                   end, SMs),
 1230: 
 1231:     %% These signals would typically not be delivered if the bug was
 1232:     %% triggered and the test case would time out.
 1233:     true = is_process_alive(R),
 1234:     unlink(R),
 1235:     exit(R, kill),
 1236:     false = is_process_alive(R),
 1237: 
 1238:     true = is_process_alive(T),
 1239:     unlink(T),
 1240:     exit(T, kill),
 1241:     false = is_process_alive(T),
 1242: 
 1243:     ok.
 1244: 
 1245: parallel_signal_enqueue_race_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1246:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 1247:     try
 1248:         parallel_signal_enqueue_race_2_test()
 1249:     after
 1250:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)
 1251:     end.
 1252: 
 1253: parallel_signal_enqueue_race_2_test() ->
 1254:     %%
 1255:     %% PR-7822 (first commit)
 1256:     %%
 1257:     %% This bug could be triggered when
 1258:     %% * A signal receiver process had the parallel signal enqueue optimization
 1259:     %%   enabled
 1260:     %% * Another process called process_info(Receiver, message_queue_len)
 1261:     %%   while the receiver was not executing and the process_info() call
 1262:     %%   internaly called erts_proc_sig_fetch() on receiver trying to
 1263:     %%   optimize the process_info() call
 1264:     %% * Yet another process simultaneously sent the receiver another
 1265:     %%   signal.
 1266:     %%
 1267:     %% When the bug was triggered, the receiver could end up in an inconsistent
 1268:     %% state where it potentially would be stuck for ever.
 1269:     %%
 1270:     %% The above scenario is very hard to trigger, so the test typically do
 1271:     %% not fail even with the bug present, but we at least try to massage
 1272:     %% the scenario...
 1273:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 1274:     {RSched, PISched, LUSched} = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1275:                                      1 ->
 1276:                                          {1, 1, 1};
 1277:                                      2 ->
 1278:                                          {2, 1, 2};
 1279:                                      3 ->
 1280:                                          {1, 2, 3};
 1281:                                      _ ->
 1282:                                          {2, 3, 4}
 1283:                                  end,
 1284:     Tester = self(),
 1285:     R = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1286:                           true = erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_buffers,
 1287:                                                                true),
 1288:                           Tester ! recv_ready,
 1289:                           receive after infinity -> ok end
 1290:                   end,
 1291:                   [{message_queue_data, off_heap}, link, {scheduler, RSched}]),
 1292: 
 1293:     PI = spawn_opt(fun PILoop () ->
 1294:                            true = is_process_alive(R),
 1295:                            Tester ! pi_ready,
 1296:                            receive go -> ok end,
 1297:                            _ = process_info(R, message_queue_len),
 1298:                            PILoop()
 1299:                    end,
 1300:                    [link, {scheduler, PISched}]),
 1301:     LU = spawn_opt(fun LULoop () ->
 1302:                            true = is_process_alive(R),
 1303:                            Tester ! lu_ready,
 1304:                            receive go -> ok end,
 1305:                            link(R),
 1306:                            unlink(R),
 1307:                            LULoop()
 1308:                    end,
 1309:                    [link, {scheduler, LUSched}]),
 1310: 
 1311:     receive recv_ready -> ok end,
 1312:     TriggerLoop = fun TriggerLoop(0) ->
 1313:                           ok;
 1314:                       TriggerLoop (N) ->
 1315:                           receive lu_ready -> ok end,
 1316:                           receive pi_ready -> ok end,
 1317:                           %% Give them some time to schedule out...
 1318:                           erlang:yield(),
 1319:                           case N rem 2 of
 1320:                               0 ->
 1321:                                   PI ! go,
 1322:                                   LU ! go;
 1323:                               1 ->
 1324:                                   LU ! go,
 1325:                                   PI ! go
 1326:                           end,
 1327:                           TriggerLoop(N-1)
 1328:                   end,
 1329:     TriggerLoop(400000),
 1330: 
 1331:     unlink(PI),
 1332:     exit(PI, kill),
 1333:     false = is_process_alive(PI),
 1334:     unlink(LU),
 1335:     exit(LU, kill),
 1336:     false = is_process_alive(LU),
 1337:     unlink(R),
 1338:     exit(R, kill),
 1339:     false = is_process_alive(R),
 1340:     ok.
 1341: 
 1342: dirty_schedule(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1343:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 1344:                           dirty_schedule_test()
 1345:                   end,
 1346:                   lists:seq(1, 5)),
 1347:     ok.
 1348: 
 1349: dirty_schedule_test() ->
 1350:     %%
 1351:     %% PR-7822 (second commit)
 1352:     %%
 1353:     %% This bug could occur when a process was to be scheduled due to an
 1354:     %% incomming signal just as the receiving process was selected for
 1355:     %% execution on a dirty scheduler. The process could then be inserted
 1356:     %% into a run-queue simultaneously as it began executing dirty. If
 1357:     %% the scheduled instance was selected for execution on one dirty
 1358:     %% scheduler simultaneously as it was scheduled out on another scheduler
 1359:     %% a race could cause the thread scheduling out the process to think it
 1360:     %% already was in the run-queue, so there is no need to insert it in the
 1361:     %% run-queue, while the other thread selecting it for execution dropped
 1362:     %% the process, since it was already running on another scheduler. By
 1363:     %% this the process ended up stuck in a runnable state, but not in the
 1364:     %% run-queue.
 1365:     %%
 1366:     %% When the bug was triggered, the receiver could end up in an inconsistent
 1367:     %% state where it potentially would be stuck for ever.
 1368:     %%
 1369:     %% The above scenario is very hard to trigger, so the test typically do
 1370:     %% not fail even with the bug present, but we at least try to massage
 1371:     %% the scenario...
 1372:     %%
 1373:     Proc = spawn_link(fun DirtyLoop () ->
 1374:                               erts_debug:dirty_io(scheduler,type),
 1375:                               DirtyLoop()
 1376:                       end),
 1377:     NoPs = lists:seq(1, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)),
 1378:     SpawnSender =
 1379:         fun (Prio) ->
 1380:                 spawn_opt(
 1381:                   fun () ->
 1382:                           Loop = fun Loop (0) ->
 1383:                                          ok;
 1384:                                      Loop (N) ->
 1385:                                          _ = process_info(Proc,
 1386:                                                           current_function),
 1387:                                          Loop(N-1)
 1388:                                  end,
 1389:                           receive go -> ok end,
 1390:                           Loop(100000)
 1391:                   end, [monitor,{priority,Prio}])
 1392:         end,
 1393:     Go = fun ({P, _M}) -> P ! go end,
 1394:     WaitProcs = fun ({P, M}) ->
 1395:                         receive {'DOWN', M, process, P, R} ->
 1396:                                 normal = R
 1397:                         end
 1398:                 end,
 1399:     PM1s = lists:map(fun (_) -> SpawnSender(normal) end, NoPs),
 1400:     lists:foreach(Go, PM1s),
 1401:     lists:foreach(WaitProcs, PM1s),
 1402:     PM2s = lists:map(fun (_) -> SpawnSender(high) end, NoPs),
 1403:     lists:foreach(Go, PM2s),
 1404:     lists:foreach(WaitProcs, PM2s),
 1405:     PM3s = lists:map(fun (N) ->
 1406:                              Prio = case N rem 2 of
 1407:                                         0 -> normal;
 1408:                                         1 -> high
 1409:                                     end,
 1410:                              SpawnSender(Prio) end, NoPs),
 1411:     lists:foreach(Go, PM3s),
 1412:     lists:foreach(WaitProcs, PM3s),
 1413:     unlink(Proc),
 1414:     exit(Proc, kill),
 1415:     false = is_process_alive(Proc),
 1416:     ok.
 1417: 
 1418: %%
 1419: %% -- Internal utils --------------------------------------------------------
 1420: %%
 1421: 
 1422: match(X,X) -> ok.
 1423: 
 1424: load_driver(Config, Driver) ->
 1425:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1426:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(DataDir, Driver) of
 1427:         ok ->
 1428:             ok;
 1429:         {error, Error} = Res ->
 1430:             io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
 1431:             Res
 1432:     end.
 1433: 
 1434: wait_until(Fun) ->
 1435:     case (catch Fun()) of
 1436:         true ->
 1437:             ok;
 1438:         _ ->
 1439:             receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1440:             wait_until(Fun)
 1441:     end.
 1442: 
 1443: find_proc_link(Pid, To) when is_pid(Pid), is_pid(To) ->
 1444:     lists:keyfind(To,
 1445:                   #erl_link.pid,
 1446:                   erts_debug:get_internal_state({link_list, Pid})).
 1447: 
 1448: make_busy(OnNode, ToNode, Time) ->
 1449:     Parent = self(),
 1450:     Fun = fun () ->
 1451:                   Proxy = self(),
 1452:                   Sspndr = spawn_link(
 1453:                              ToNode,
 1454:                              fun () ->
 1455:                                      IC = find_gen_tcp_input_cntrlr(OnNode),
 1456:                                      erlang:suspend_process(IC),
 1457:                                      Proxy ! {self(), input_cntrlr_suspended},
 1458:                                      receive
 1459:                                          {Proxy, resume_input_cntrlr} ->
 1460:                                              erlang:resume_process(IC)
 1461:                                      end,
 1462:                                      Proxy ! {self(), input_cntrlr_resumed}
 1463:                              end),
 1464:                   receive
 1465:                       {Sspndr, input_cntrlr_suspended} ->
 1466:                           ok
 1467:                   end,
 1468:                   Spammer = spawn_link(
 1469:                               OnNode,
 1470:                               fun () ->
 1471:                                       spammed = spam(ToNode),
 1472:                                       Proxy ! {self(), channel_busy},
 1473:                                       receive
 1474:                                       after Time -> ok
 1475:                                       end,
 1476:                                       Proxy ! {self(), timeout}
 1477:                               end),
 1478:                   receive
 1479:                       {Spammer, channel_busy} ->
 1480:                           Parent ! {self(), channel_busy}
 1481:                   end,
 1482:                   receive
 1483:                       {Spammer, timeout} ->
 1484:                           Sspndr ! {self(), resume_input_cntrlr}
 1485:                   end,
 1486:                   receive
 1487:                       {Sspndr, input_cntrlr_resumed} ->
 1488:                           ok
 1489:                   end
 1490:           end,
 1491:     Proxy = spawn_link(Fun),
 1492:     receive
 1493:         {Proxy, channel_busy} ->
 1494:             ok
 1495:     end,
 1496:     Proxy.
 1497: 
 1498: find_gen_tcp_input_cntrlr(Node) when is_atom(Node) ->
 1499:     case lists:keyfind(Node, 1, erlang:system_info(dist_ctrl)) of
 1500:         {Node, DistCtrl} ->
 1501:             find_gen_tcp_input_cntrlr(DistCtrl);
 1502:         false ->
 1503:             undefined
 1504:     end;
 1505: find_gen_tcp_input_cntrlr(DistCtrl) when is_pid(DistCtrl) ->
 1506:     {links, LList} = process_info(DistCtrl, links),
 1507:     try
 1508:         lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 1509:                               case process_info(Pid, initial_call) of
 1510:                                   {initial_call,
 1511:                                    {gen_tcp_dist,dist_cntrlr_input_setup,3}} ->
 1512:                                       throw({input_ctrlr, Pid});
 1513:                                   _ ->
 1514:                                       ok
 1515:                               end
 1516:                       end,
 1517:                       LList),
 1518:         undefined
 1519:     catch
 1520:         throw:{input_ctrlr, DistInputCtrlr} ->
 1521:             DistInputCtrlr
 1522:     end.
 1523: 
 1524: spam(Node) ->
 1525:     To = {'__a_name_hopefully_not_registered__', Node},
 1526:     Data = lists:seq(1, 100),
 1527:     spam(To, Data).
 1528: 
 1529: spam(To, Data) ->
 1530:     case erlang:send(To, Data, [nosuspend]) of
 1531:         nosuspend ->
 1532:             spammed;
 1533:         _ ->
 1534:             spam(To, Data)
 1535:     end.
 1536: 
 1537: repeat(_Fun, N) when is_integer(N), N =< 0 ->
 1538:     ok;
 1539: repeat(Fun, N) when is_function(Fun, 0), is_integer(N)  ->
 1540:     Fun(),
 1541:     repeat(Fun, N-1);
 1542: repeat(Fun, N) when is_function(Fun, 1), is_integer(N)  ->
 1543:     Fun(N),
 1544:     repeat(Fun, N-1).
 1545: 
 1546: busy_wait_until(Fun) ->
 1547:     case catch Fun() of
 1548:         true -> ok;
 1549:         _ -> busy_wait_until(Fun)
 1550:     end.
